abstract: Here's a dose of politics, Silicon Valley style. Two investors, Ron Conway and Sean Parker, have teamed up to finance a promotional video for a San Francisco mayoral candidate, Ed Lee, reports TechCrunch. The two-minute video, a remake of M.C. Hammer's 1991 song "Too Legit to Quit," stars Twitter's co-founder, Biz Stone; a Google executive, Marissa Mayer; Will.i.am of the Black Eyed Peas; and yes, Mr. Hammer.
